akus.title: Why Portfolios Beat Resumes
akus.concept:
Skills without proof are just claims. Your portfolio is evidence.

**Resume says:** 'Experienced with AI tools'
**Portfolio shows:** 'Built 3 automations that saved 10 hours/week'

**What employers want to see:**
1. Real problems you've solved
2. Your thought process and methodology
3. Measurable results
4. Technical skills applied practically

**AI portfolios are different:**
- Show the prompts you built
- Document automations that work
- Demonstrate before/after results
- Include your systematic approach

**Key insight:** Hiring managers spend 6 seconds on resumes. Portfolios get minutes of attention and stick in memory.

sandboxChallenge.prompt: Write a 2-minute pitch for why an employer should look at your AI portfolio instead of just your resume. What can a portfolio show that a resume can't?
hints: Think about what makes AI skills hard to describe
Consider what employers are really trying to learn
Focus on proof over claims

akus.title: The Case Study Framework
akus.concept:
Every portfolio piece should follow the Case Study Framework.

**The PSAR Structure:**

**P - Problem**
What challenge were you facing?
'I was spending 3 hours/week summarizing meeting notes manually.'

**S - Solution**
What did you build/create?
'I created an AI-powered meeting summarizer using...'

**A - Approach**
How did you solve it?
'I used CTFC prompting, Chain of Thought reasoning, and automated it with Zapier.'

**R - Results**
What was the measurable outcome?
'Reduced meeting note processing from 3 hours to 15 minutes/week. 90% time savings.'

**Always include:**
- The actual prompts you used
- Screenshots or recordings
- Metrics where possible
- What you learned

sandboxChallenge.prompt: Using the PSAR framework, write a case study for ONE project you built during this course (Prompt Library, Decision Assistant, Content Generator, or Brand Voice Assistant).
hints: Be specific about the problem you faced
Include the actual techniques you used
Quantify results if possible (time saved, quality improved)
Mention what you learned

akus.title: Curating Your Prompt Library
akus.concept:
Your Prompt Library is a showcase of your AI engineering skills.

**What to include:**
- Your best reusable prompts
- Different categories (writing, analysis, coding, etc.)
- Clear documentation for each

**For each prompt, document:**
1. **Purpose** - What problem it solves
2. **The Prompt** - Full text with all components
3. **Example Output** - What it produces
4. **Usage Tips** - How to customize it
5. **Pattern Used** - CTFC, CoT, Few-Shot, etc.

**Organization tips:**
- Group by use case or category
- Include difficulty levels
- Mark your favorites
- Update regularly with improvements

sandboxChallenge.prompt:
Document 3 prompts from your work in this course. For each one, include:

1. Name and purpose
2. The complete prompt
3. What techniques it uses (CTFC, CoT, Few-Shot, etc.)
4. Example of what it produces
5. How to customize it for different uses
hints: Choose your most useful prompts
Include the complete prompt text
Explain what makes each one effective
Show a real example output

akus.title: Documenting Your Automations
akus.concept:
Your automations show that you can build systems, not just prompts.

**For each automation, document:**

**1. Overview**
- Name and one-sentence description
- What triggers it
- What it produces

**2. Architecture**
- Trigger → Steps → Output diagram
- Tools used (Zapier, Make, etc.)
- AI model and settings

**3. The AI Prompt**
- Full prompt text
- Why you structured it this way
- Variables it uses

**4. Results**
- Time saved
- Accuracy/quality metrics
- Cost per run

**5. Lessons Learned**
- What worked well
- What you'd do differently
- Potential improvements

sandboxChallenge.prompt: Create complete documentation for your Content Generator automation from Module 3. Include all 5 sections: Overview, Architecture, AI Prompt, Results, and Lessons Learned.
hints: Start with a clear one-sentence description
Draw or describe the flow diagram
Include actual metrics if you have them
Be honest about what you'd improve

akus.title: Your Professional Summary
akus.concept:
Your portfolio needs a compelling professional summary that ties everything together.

**The Summary Structure:**

**1. Who You Are** (1-2 sentences)
'AI-enabled [role] who uses artificial intelligence to [key value you provide].'

**2. What You've Built** (2-3 sentences)
'I've created [number] automation systems that [impact]. My prompt engineering saves [time/money].'

**3. Key Capabilities** (bullet list)
- Prompt engineering (CTFC, CoT, Few-Shot)
- Workflow automation (Zapier, Make)
- AI integration and API usage
- [Specific skills relevant to your target role]

**4. What's Next** (1 sentence)
'I'm looking to apply these skills to [target role/company type].'

**Pro tip:** Customize this for each job application.

sandboxChallenge.prompt: Write your professional summary following the structure above. Make it specific to your actual skills and the type of role you're targeting.
hints: Be specific about what role you're targeting
Reference real projects you built in this course
Make capabilities relevant to your target role
Keep it concise but impactful

akus.title: Assemble Your Complete Portfolio
akus.concept:
Final Capstone: Put everything together into a complete, professional portfolio.

**Portfolio Structure:**

**1. Professional Summary**
- Your summary from the previous exercise

**2. Case Studies (3)**
- Your best projects in PSAR format
- Include actual prompts and outputs

**3. Prompt Library**
- 5+ documented reusable prompts
- Organized by category

**4. Automations**
- Working systems you've built
- Documentation and results

**5. Skills & Certifications**
- AI techniques mastered
- Tools you can use
- This certificate upon completion

**Presentation options:**
- Notion page (free, easy)
- GitHub repository
- Personal website
- PDF document

sandboxChallenge.prompt:
Create the complete structure for your portfolio. Include:

1. Your professional summary
2. Outlines for 3 case studies (using projects from this course)
3. Your prompt library (5+ prompts, organized)
4. Your automation documentation
5. A skills list with the techniques you've learned

This is your capstone deliverable!
hints: Start with your professional summary
Reference all the work you've done in this course
Make sure case studies follow PSAR format
Organize prompts by category
Be comprehensive but not overwhelming
